title: Janitor/Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Manhattan College (London, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Really smooth interview process and appeared to be good people. The job wasn’t right for me though. Good work culture and ethics too. I would recommend this company to anyone.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and they asked typical questions of the role I was applying for. I was able to find out quickly if I received the job or not and I was excited to start.
Interview Questions: What is your background in it

title: Student Asisstant Interview
Interview Descriptions: This is a great place to be. Located in the Bronx, you have a great sense of community. The people here are friendly and willing to help you out whenever you are in need. Just 30 minutes away from the city, by train, you have NYC as your campus.
Interview Questions: What past experiences did you learn from the most ?

title: Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was extensive. The 1st one was online and the 2nd one was in person but I had to be interviewed by 5 people separately. It was an all day process.

title: Part-time Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Manhattan College (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Job position was open. Sent in resume and coverletter. Received an email they would like to meet with me and met with the graduate assistant and one of the recruiters. Very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tour guide?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Manhattan College in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview at first. The math department chair person along with a senior faculty were on the phone. It was a short interview for about fifteen minutes. After that, they asked me for a in-class presentation.
Interview Questions: They asked if I did some untraditional teaching, which is something besides lecturing.

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was two ladies in charge of conference services that conducted the interview. Only asked basic interview questions.  Asked more in-depth about previous work experiences. lasted for about 10-15 minutes.
Interview Questions: what did you do when a customer got upset at your previous job?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Manhattan College (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easygoing interview, formal with 2 interviewers in the room. Asked questions about my ability to handle the job and why I wanted the job in the first place. Very nice people, easy to talk to, and made me feel comfortable during the process.
Interview Questions: How comfortable am I with presenting myself as a representative of the office in person and on the phone?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief interview between the manager and me. We spoke about my history at Hunter College, how familiar I was with computers. I was briefed the nature of the job. There was a period of training where I learned how to use team dynamix, and I went directly into the job.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with computers?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Manhattan College
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call back from HR after a month. The interview process was fairly relaxed. First, I met with a hiring manager to review my qualifications and background. Right after, I interviewed with the manager of the department of the position, who mostly explained the position and asked questions about my work experience. Nothing extreme or unexpected. I didn't get a call back, but the staff and campus left a good impression on me.

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is really easy and smooth. I had a quick talk with the manager and I was offered a position on spot. It is easier if you know people already working as grad assistants but you will probably get the position either way.

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asked me the basics of how to troubleshoot a computer and how to access different parts of an operating system in order to troubleshoot further. From there they asked how I would deal with specific customers depending on certain situations and problems
Interview Questions: How would you go about troubleshooting a computer that won't turn on?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: First and second interview; I had good experience for an entry level employee so the interviews went well. Very focused on the College mission, which I appreciated very much, so be prepared for answering how you will contribute to the college mission. Dress in business clothes/suit although once the job started it was ok to dress more casually. Other staff were very supportive of my development and the faculty were so approachable and warm.
Interview Questions:
How my work would contribute to mission?
How I would manage my time and multiple responsibilities?

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and later received a phone call screen. After the phone screen there was an in person interview. Motivated to move if you have the right stuff. The school is located in a nestled part of the Bronx called Riverdale, very nice campus. The people are generally friendly.

title: Night Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Manhattan College (Bronx, NY) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer looked at my resume and briefly asked me to verify its contents and then I was hired!
